Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy Nation was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Attempt Attempt Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive; AS TO BOTH COUNTS; and any other sentence

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA and restitution surcharge by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

timeConds.notes: At the Day Reporting Center with electronic monitoring for the last month if, deemed appropriate.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF FAILURE TO MEET CONDITIONS FOR EXPUNGEMENT RECEIVED ANDAND FILE OS
REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Marilyn S and Alice S.  
The Court sentenced the defendant
As to Count 1: 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 94 days credit CONSECUTIVE to Count 2.
As to Count 2: 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit.
These sentences in Count 1 &2 are consecutive to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.   Court allows for dosage probation.
Conditions of Probation:
- 5 months condition time at the Day Reporting Center with electronic monitoring for the last month if deemed appropriate.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $500.00 to Cecelia O.
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
letters of support on behalf of the defendant
SPD Court Report
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Leroy Nation in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Leroy Nation in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk
As to Counts 1 & 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum and elements, received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Leroy Nation not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.

Defendant Leroy Nation in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Leroy Nation in custody.  Michael White, student intern under the supervision and with Ronald Dague for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of all the State's witnesses.  Sworn for the state:William Morales-MPD Officer, Scott Lemke-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Leroy Nation in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Leroy Nation in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 REPEATER ENHANCER   Motion to STRIKE REPEATER ENHANCER, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
